items.description: Slot configuration grid should display in two columns matching FFXIV character sheet layout. Left column: Weapon, Head, Body, Hands, Legs, Feet. Right column: Earrings, Necklace, Bracelets, Ring 1, Ring 2.
steps_to_verify: Open the job configuration page
Verify slots appear in two columns
Left column should show (top to bottom): Weapon, Head, Body, Hands, Legs, Feet
Right column should show (top to bottom): Earrings, Necklace, Bracelets, Ring 1, Ring 2

items.description: Job gear table should display slots in two-column layout matching FFXIV character sheet. Left column: Weapon, Head, Body, Hands, Legs, Feet. Right column: Earrings, Necklace, Bracelets, Ring 1, Ring 2.
steps_to_verify: Select a job to view gear table
Verify gear slots are displayed in two-column layout
Left column: Weapon, Head, Body, Hands, Legs, Feet (in order)
Right column: Earrings, Necklace, Bracelets, Ring 1, Ring 2 (in order)

items.description: Add a separate 'Source' column to the gear table. Move the source info (e.g., '2nd Turn', '495 tomes') out of the Type column into its own column.
steps_to_verify: Select a job to view gear table
Verify table has a 'Source' column header
Type column should only show 'Raid' or 'Tome'
Source column should show the turn number for raid items (e.g., '2nd Turn')
Source column should show tomestone cost for tome items (e.g., '495 tomes')

items.description: Tomestone summary should reduce when user checks 'Base' checkbox, not when they check 'Upgraded'. The base item costs tomestones; the upgrade does not.
steps_to_verify: Add a job with tome gear slots
Note the total tomestones needed in summary
Check the 'Base' checkbox for a tome item
Verify tomestones needed decreases by that slot's cost
Uncheck 'Base', verify tomestones increases back
Check 'Base' again, then check 'Upgraded' - tomestone count should not change when checking Upgraded

items.description: Remove hover state styling from the gear table rows.
steps_to_verify: Select a job to view gear table
Hover over gear table rows
Verify no hover effect (background change, highlighting) occurs on rows

items.description: Add 'Glaze' tracking to raid drops summary. Jewelry (earrings, necklace, bracelets, rings) requires Glaze from 2nd Turn to upgrade.
steps_to_verify: Add a job with tome jewelry slots
View the raid drops summary panel
Verify '2nd Turn' line shows Glaze count (e.g., '2 drops, 1 Glaze')
Glaze count equals number of unupgraded tome jewelry slots

items.description: Add 'Twine' tracking to raid drops summary. Non-weapon armor (head, body, hands, legs, feet) requires Twine from 3rd Turn to upgrade.
steps_to_verify: Add a job with tome armor slots (head/body/hands/legs/feet)
View the raid drops summary panel
Verify '3rd Turn' line shows Twine count (e.g., '1 drop, 2 Twine')
Twine count equals number of unupgraded tome armor slots

items.description: Add 'Solvent' tracking to raid drops summary. Tome weapon requires Solvent from 3rd Turn to upgrade.
steps_to_verify: Add a job with tome weapon slot
View the raid drops summary panel
Verify '3rd Turn' line includes Solvent (e.g., '1 drop, 1 Twine, 1 Solvent')
Solvent only appears when weapon is tome and not upgraded

items.description: Upgrade materials (Glaze/Twine/Solvent) appear for any tome item not yet upgraded, regardless of base purchase status.
steps_to_verify: Add a job with tome slots
Do NOT check 'Base' for any tome items
Verify Glaze/Twine/Solvent still appear in summary
Check 'Base' but not 'Upgraded' - upgrade materials should still show
Check 'Upgraded' - that slot's upgrade material should disappear from count
